doc.abstracts: On April 27, 1994 Erle Cocke, Jr. was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by William Becker, Jochen Kraske and David Milobsky. During his tenure at the Bank from 1961 to 1964, Mr. Cocke served as the Alternate Executive Director for the United States. John M. Leddy was the Executive Director for the United States during his tenure. Mr. Cocke's transcript discusses his time at the Bank during the Bank presidencies of Eugene Black (1949-1962) and George Woods (1963-1968), which corresponded the change in the administrations of US Presidents from John F. Kennedy to Lyndon B. Johnson. After his tenure at the Bank by the recommendation of President Johnson, Mr. Cocke unsuccessfully ran for Congress for a seat in the United States House of Representatives to represent his home state of Georgia.
